meanings.definition: To cause inconvenience or discomfort to
meanings.sent1: Carrying heavy bags can incommode your arms.
meanings.sent2: Please do not incommode others by leaving your belongings in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain incommoded our picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: His sudden arrival incommoded the carefully planned surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator incommodes residents on the upper floors.

meanings.sent1: Running out of milk was an incommode during breakfast.

meanings.sent3: Forgetting his umbrella was a small incommode on an otherwise sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The power outage was an unexpected incommode during the important presentation.
meanings.sent5: The lack of parking spaces is a daily incommode for employees.
